it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.specialNodes

Class ForkNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simcomp.basic.entities.BasicComponentLevelEntity<User,Events>
      • it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.general.JEQNElement
        • it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.specialNodes.SpecialNode
          • it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.specialNodes.ForkNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.data.ComponentLevelEntity, it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.data.GeneralEntity, it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.interfaces.Layer2ToLayer3

    public class ForkNode
extends SpecialNode
    Implements the EQN ForkNode, that is the node that generates a set of child users that are to be synchronized at a specified Join node. A specified policy it is used to detemine the number of child users generate, but it should be noted that for each incoming user the following users are routed to the outport: - a dadUser, that wraps the incoming user - n childUser, where n accords to the policy decision. Finally, it should be noted that the Fork node does not implement any routing policy: outgoing users are forwarded to the same output port. If needed, a Router node must be placed as cascade entity.
    Author:
    Daniele Gianni
    See Also:
    JoinNode, DadUser, SonUser

      • ForkNode

        public ForkNode(JEQNName name,
        JEQNTimeFactory timeFactory,
        it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.factories.Layer3ToLayer2Factory layer2factory,
        double userForwardDelay,
        MaskBasePolicy<?,User,?,java.lang.Integer> forkPolicy,
        SonUserGenerator sonUserGenerator,
        it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.data.Time interUserDelay)
         throws it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.exceptions.InvalidNameException
        Creates a new ForkNode
        Parameters:
        name - Element name. The name is used to identify entities within the simulation model.
        timeFactory - Instances the jEQN time object that contains the value for the simulation time.
        layer2factory - According to the Factory pattern, factory is used to instantiates the implementation of Layer3ToLayer2 interface, which provides level 3 services to level 2.
        userForwardDelay - The delay introduced to send a processed users to the next entity.
        forkPolicy - policy Policy that determines how many child users have to be generated for each incoming user
        sonUserGenerator - Generator of child users.
        interUserDelay - The delay time introduced to forward outgoing users to the cascade entity
        Throws:
        it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.simarch.exceptions.InvalidNameException - An InvalidNameException is raised when an issue concerning the element name occurs.
